title: Aurora Shooter Was Terminated, Then Killed Plant Manager, Other Workers
summary: 'He opened fire right after the termination,' police said; shooter had a prior felony conviction, was denied a concealed carry permit. AURORA, Ill.-A worker-termination meeting at an Aurora, Ill., factory turned deadly when the employee being fired pulled out a handgun and killed the plant manager, the human-resources manager and an intern, authorities said Saturday.

title: Pope Francis, in a First, Dismisses U.S. Cardinal From the Priesthood
summary: Decision to defrock Theodore McCarrick comes ahead of a Vatican summit on sex abuse next week. ROME-The Vatican found former Cardinal Theodore McCarrick of Washington guilty of sexual abuse of minors and sexual misconduct with adults, and dismissed him from the priesthood, completing an astonishing fall from grace for a man who was once one of the most powerful figures in the U.S. Catholic Church.

title: The Victims of Friday's Shooting in Aurora, Ill.
summary: A union representative and an intern working on his first day are among the five fatally shot. The victims of Friday's shooting at Henry Pratt Co. in Aurora, Ill., included a union representative who had been trying to help the shooter keep his job and a college student on the first day of his internship.

title: U.S. Aid for Venezuelans Arrives, Setting Up Showdown With Regime
summary: Opposition leader Juan Guaidó to pressure the military to allow the food and supplies in as President Maduro remains defiant. The first U.S. military aircraft carrying aid for Venezuela arrived in Colombia on Saturday as the Trump administration steps up pressure to oust embattled President Nicolás Maduro, whose authoritarian government has blocked foreign donations.

title: Africa Is Getting a Basketball League of Its Own
summary: Initial plan is for 12 teams to begin play in January, and former President Barack Obama seeks to be involved. CHARLOTTE, N.C.-The NBA is bringing a pro league to Africa.

title: Tod's Loafers Have Won Over Royals and Hollywood-But Not Many Millennials
summary: The Tod's brand gets less than 15% of revenue from shoppers in their 20s and 30s, compared with 50% for Gucci and 65% for Saint Laurent. CASETTE D'ETE, Italy- Tod's SpA built a billion-dollar business on the back of chic leather loafers worn by royals and Hollywood stars. Catching the eye of a younger generation of consumers hasn't been so easy.

title: Russia Formally Arrests American Businessman
summary: Case threatens to exacerbate already strained relations between Washington and Moscow. MOSCOW-The American founder of a private-equity firm detained this week in Moscow on fraud charges was formally arrested Saturday and is set to remain in custody for at least about two months.

title: New White House, Congressional Spending Fights on the Horizon
summary: Lawmakers must once again raise the federal borrowing limit by late summer or early fall, and reach a new budget deal by the end of September. The protracted spending impasse that ended Friday, following the longest government shutdown in U.S. history, was just a prelude to other fiscal fights looming for the White House and Congress this year.

title: Airline Bookings to Offer New Gender Options
summary: Ticketing with options beyond male or female will help match passenger records with official IDs. Airlines are planning to change their reservation systems to give passengers who don't identify as male or female another option when booking flights.

title: Tax Shortfalls Widen New York's Revenue Gap
summary: Gov. Andrew Cuomo proposes moving money between state accounts and other actions to cover the difference. Gov. Andrew Cuomo proposed moving money between state accounts and other one-shot actions to cover a $2.6 billion state revenue shortfall, according to a budget update.

title: Art Galleries Brush Off Chelsea for Tribeca
summary: Lower rents and a grittier feel are making Tribeca the new 'old' SoHo. More than 40 years ago, gallery owners in New York City started to embrace downtown Manhattan, particularly SoHo, as the new artistic hot spot.

title: Report Faults Former Housing-Finance Regulator Watt
summary: Inspector general says ex-director misused position to 'coerce or induce' female employee into relationship. WASHINGTON-Mel Watt, the former regulator for Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac , misused his position by attempting to "coerce or induce" a female employee into a relationship, according to an internal watchdog's report.

title: China's Property Market, Once a Lifeline, Shows Growing Strains
summary: Beijing relied on home buying to help boost the economy in 2015, but concerns about debt and house prices could limit that option now. SHANGRAO, China-Investors were pouring into this sleepy city in southeastern China until late last year to scoop up apartments as new high-rise projects mushroomed.

title: 'Seeing the Divine: Pahari Painting of North India' Review: Multifaceted Devotion
summary: In these religious works, painters bring to life ancient poetry and epics with an eye to engaging viewers emotionally.. New York

title: Europe Playing Catch-Up on New Benchmark Rates
summary: Corporate treasurers face challenges as they prepare to move away from expiring benchmarks. The European Union is lagging behind the U.S. and U.K. in efforts to switch to new benchmarks underpinning financial contracts, pressuring treasurers at eurozone companies.

title: Nigeria Postpones Presidential Election
summary: Western diplomats say the vote was delayed because election materials hadn't been delivered to polling stations. Nigeria's electoral commission delayed the presidential vote for a week, making the announcement five hours before polls were due to open for what was set to be Africa's largest election.

title: Brazil Probe Finds Vale Auditor, Employees Knew Dam Wasn't Stable
summary: Police also carried out warrants to seize documents and other material. SÃO PAULO-Brazilian police arrested eight employees of mining giant Vale SA on suspicion of murder after a judge found evidence suggesting they had known for months about significant safety problems at one of its dams before it burst last month, killing more than 160 people.

title: Saudi Crown Prince Pivots to Asia After Criticism From West
summary: Mohammed bin Salman's visits to China, India and Pakistan aimed at promoting investment and strategic ties. Saudi Arabia's crown prince is embarking on what is expected to be a three-country sweep through Asia to nurture alliances there as the murder of a Saudi dissident and the Saudi-led war in Yemen continue to disrupt the kingdom's relations with the U.S. and European powers.

title: Ex-Goldman Banker in 1MDB Case Yields on U.S. Extradition
summary: Malaysian citizen Roger Ng had been fighting being sent to the U.S., where an indictment was issued in November. KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia-A former Goldman Sachs GS -2.17% Group Inc. banker has agreed to be extradited to the U.S. from Malaysia to contest charges over one of the world's largest financial scandals, his lawyer said.

title: The Fitness Plan for Serious Schmoozers
summary: A county official in Pennsylvania found a way to shake off all those evening events by falling in with a group of early-morning exercisers. Being an elected official can feel like attending a wedding six days a week. As chair of the Board of County Commissioners in Chester County, Pa., Republican Michelle Kichline says it's common for her to sit down to the equivalent of a wedding feast almost daily. "When every day of your life is a special event, you will put on weight," she says.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Paper Towels Cost How Much?
summary: As companies raise prices for a number of popular items, a look at the price bumps for eight leading products, from diapers to toothpaste. It's not your imagination: Prices for everything from diapers to bleach have been going up, and some makers plan to raise prices on various other products again this year. Manufacturers cite higher costs for transportation and raw materials like pulp, fiber and resin. To see just how much prices have gone up, analysts from Bernstein Research looked at increases from January 2018 to January 2019 for the top selling items in their categories, using the national average prices in stores tracked by Nielsen. Here's a look at the price bumps for eight popular items, and some of the reasons for them. -Aisha Al-Muslim

title: The Truth About Failing Spectacularly
summary: Did a lack of experience sink the MS Explorer-and the Los Angeles Rams?. Twelve years ago, the world's most renowned polar cruise ship, the MS Explorer, set out from a deep-water port in Argentina toward the icy, treacherous waters of Antarctica.

title: Nigeria Braces for Climax of Rancorous Presidential Showdown
summary: The vote, which has been delayed to Feb. 23, pits challenger seeking economic shake-up against incumbent focused on security and corruption. KADUNA, Nigeria-The largest election in Africa's history is already shaping up to be one of its more volatile.

title: Chicago Police Release Possible Suspects in Jussie Smollett Attack
summary: Police push back against claim that attack on 'Empire' star was a hoax. Chicago Police said they released two possible suspects without charging them in an alleged attack reported last month by "Empire" television star Jussie Smollett.

title: Gunman Kills Five Employees in Illinois Factory Shooting
summary: Five police officers were shot, but not killed, in an attack that also left the gunman dead. A man being terminated after 15 years at an Aurora, Ill., factory opened fire in his workplace Friday afternoon, killing five employees and shooting five officers before being killed by police, authorities said.

title: The Tech Whiz Behind Vine and HQ Trivia Made Millions in His 20s. He Was Dead by 34
summary: Resume Subscription. Colin Kroll, a college dropout turned startup millionaire, drifted through his company's holiday party at Gran Morsi, a cozy Italian restaurant in downtown Manhattan. Dressed in a gray sweater and jeans, he chatted up employees and their plus ones.

title: Trump Declares Emergency Over Wall, Inviting Likely Court Fight
summary: Plan heads off another shutdown, diverts money from elsewhere in government to pay for additional barriers. WASHINGTON-President Trump declared a national emergency Friday over border security, bypassing Congress to divert money from elsewhere in the government to pay for additional barriers along the southern border, a move likely to ignite immediate court challenges.

title: Senate Panel Probes 2015 Meetings Involving Russian Maria Butina and Fed, Treasury Officials
summary: The Senate Finance Committee is requesting records relating to the meetings. Senators are seeking information about Obama-era meetings between Treasury and Federal Reserve officials and Maria Butina, the alleged Russian agent who pleaded guilty to conspiring to influence U.S. policy.

title: Paul Manafort Could Get Two-Decade Prison Sentence
summary: The office of special prosecutor Robert Mueller said it agreed with sentencing guidelines for Manafort's convictions. Paul Manafort could face more than 19 years in prison for crimes including not paying taxes on $16 million in income, prosecutors said, raising the prospect that the former Trump campaign chairman could spend much of the rest of his life behind bars.

title: Why Amazon's New York U-Turn Is Good for America's Tech Economy
summary: Amazon's decision to put one of its new headquarters in New York City would have exacerbated America's geographic inequality. Now the company has a chance to do better. Amazon.com Inc.'s abandoned plans for a New York City headquarters may have prompted mixed reactions in the Big Apple, but for the rest of the country, it's good news.

title: U.S. Puts Sanctions on More Venezuelan Officials
summary: Action further sidelines President Nicolás Maduro's control over state oil giant PdVSA. The U.S. sanctioned the head of Venezuela's state-owned oil giant and five top intelligence and security officials and the Trump administration said it planned to deliver at least 200 tons of humanitarian aid to a border city in Colombia, intensifying its effort to ratchet up pressure on President Nicolás Maduro.

title: Payless to Close All U.S. Stores as It Prepares for Another Bankruptcy
summary: Chain's closure likely will be the largest-ever U.S. retail liquidation. Strangled by debt and new rivals, discount shoe chain Payless ShoeSource Inc. is closing its roughly 2,100 U.S. locations in what is likely to be the largest-ever retailer liquidation by number of stores.

title: Amazon Project Foundered on Labor Organizing, Debate Over Subsidies
summary: Amid backlash, talks to resolve differences failed to allay company's growing unease. Jeff Bezos and other top Amazon executives gathered in Seattle on Wednesday to decide whether to go ahead with its planned headquarters in New York City.

title: Funding and Location of Wall Likely to Spark Conflicts
summary: Determining which military construction funds to use-in which states, and in which services-has political implications. President Trump's proposal to move billions of dollars from military spending and drug interdiction to fund the construction of 234 miles of barriers on the southern border sets up two new conflicts: one over where the money is coming from, and one over where it might go.
